ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
In the past two weeks, how often did your child have trouble falling asleep or staying asleep when he or she was tired and wanted to sleep?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Rarely; 2=Several days; 3=More than half the days; 4=Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Was there ever a time, for two weeks or longer, that your child had trouble falling asleep or staying asleep when he or she was tired and wanted to sleep?
Was there ever another time, for two weeks or longer, that your child had trouble falling asleep or staying asleep when he or she was tired and wanted to sleep?
When was that? If this was true of your child more than once, let me know when it was the worst.
